website_summaries.verdict: The Logitech Create might be the best way to get productive on a 9.7-inch iPad Pro, but only consider this case if you're ready to use your iPad in laptop mode most of the time.
pros: The Logitech Create has backlit keys, a Pencil-holding loop, connects via the iPad Pro's Smart Connector so it doesn't need recharging, and costs less than Apple's Smart Keyboard
cons: The case feels a little bulky
The case works well when typing, but feels awkward as an everyday case for reading or movie-watching

customer_reviews.title: Keys are prone to pop off
customer_reviews.text: I don't typically write reviews for items not purchased on Amazon, because I tend not to trust reviews I read, that aren't verified purchases. However, I'm including a photo to back this up. I purchased my Logitech iPad Pro case in February and it's been on my ipad since. I noticed about a month ago, that the black paint on the "T" key had worn thru and is now a blaring light. Today, one of the other keys just popped offf. It will not snap back in place. For what this case cost, $130 . . .that's $32.50 per month of use I spent. It's just not worth the price I paid. Wish I'd bought the Apple keyboard instead.
customer_reviews.author: RobinDTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Returned it.  iPad quit charging when keyboard was attached.
customer_reviews.text: I called Apple about their keyboard and the sales associate recommended this one because it had a pencil holder. She said she had it and loved it. I took her recommendation and bought it, but I returned the keyboard because I couldn’t charge my iPad while it was attached. It was really weird I had no problem charging the pad when the keyboard wasn’t attached. If I am in the middle of working on something and my iPad’s battery gets low, I should be able to charge it without disconnecting the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky B

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product; best iPad Pro Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is without a doubt the best keyboard you can buy for iPad Pro. I also purchased the Apple Keyboard/Cover, which was about 50% more expensive. Compared to this it was really flimsy, and had a really poor feel when typing. It also tended to try to fall backwards when in the typing position. This on the other hand, had amazing tactile typing feel and a great backlight. It also is a case, which saves more money compared to the Apple Keyboard which would also need a back case to protect the iPad. I would recommend this to anyone who needs to do serious typing on their iPad Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Kauble

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw drops this from a 5 to a 1!!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this case/keyboard...except the design flaw which renders it unusable! After less than 3 months, and right after my return date and buyer support time had run out, a strip of plastic on the case near the bottom of my iPad broke. The case function depends on the iPad being held in by pressure, and when this strip fails the iPad slides out. I've tried to super glue it, but after about a week it breaks again. This is really a bummer because there just isn't another case like it!!
customer_reviews.author: dcstod

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this keyboard with 2016 iPad pro. I love the backlit keys, it is comfortable to type, and works with no issues with the iPad. I use this for meetings, to take notes, or to type emails when I am away from my computer. The only thing that could improve is the weight and also it's a bit thick when you include iPad. I still have my basic (light) case for when I need to browse internet or watch movies. listen to music, etc. Overall, I'm pleased with the purchase and it's a good option for business use of iPad. I have not seen screen scratches as some other customers have reported.
customer_reviews.author: W. Solis

customer_reviews.title: Sort of good, not very rugged
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my keyboard in June 2019. The case, where it holds the iPad in place cracked after a month or two. In Feb 2020, two of the keys stopped working. I think I got water on it while cleaning it with a damp rag. I am trying to see if the 1 year warranty covers the issues, otherwise I’ll be back in the market for a new keyboard. I had an apple keyboard prior to getting this one. That was a nicer keyboard and lasted me about 2 years. I bought this as an inexpensive replacement, hoping this would last long enough that I would be ready to retire my iPad. I guess that plan didn’t work well.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Best iPad keyboard ever!! Doesn't use bluetooth and never needs charging. It uses the battery from the iPad to charge. When it is connected, they keyboard works and when it is disconnected, you can use the on screen keyboard. There are many hot keys. Makes my iPad more like a laptop. I use this daily!!
customer_reviews.author: LoopyLouHandmade

customer_reviews.title: Case cracks and breaks at the weak points
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard case is the fourth one that I have owned. This one also broke at the attachment point for the iPad on the right side. I returned one for a replacement but the hassle wasn't worth it. I have repaired the others with superglue. The only reason I continue to buy them is that it has the quick connection and the keyboard works well.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D. Rusk

customer_reviews.title: Best Ipad Pro Keyboard out there
customer_reviews.text: This could be the best ipad keyboard that I've ever tried and I've tried several. I am still not convinced that an ipad can replace my mac or windows PC; however, this keyboard makes it easier. It's pricey, but it looks great, touch on the keyboard equals a full size keyboard and the fact that there's no pairing and no charging the keyboard is worth the cost. Back light is a plus and response is quick, with no latency. I would recommend this keyboard for anyone who has tried a keyboard before but hasn't found the right one.
customer_reviews.author: Linda G.

customer_reviews.title: Already not working.
customer_reviews.text: Already not working. I bought this in mid feb 2017 and just a couple of days ago the keyboard went out completely. Will not connect to my iPad Pro nor will it even light up on the keyboard. I remember when Logitech made great products now they make crap and charge you too much for it. I've already tried to contact them twice through a warranty claim and not one csr has gotten back to me. Not only do their products suck but the customer service is just as bad! No more Logitech products for this guy.
customer_reviews.author: gilbert sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard great, case will break.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard works great. I got it to replace another ipad case where the keyboard was awful. But the case for this unit is very poorly designed, and the thin part that surrounds the speaker is pretty much sure to break. Before that happens, it holds the iPad nicely. After that, not so well, it keeps getting loose. So just make a warranty claim? I had a LifeProof case for my iPhone which had a problem, and their warranty claim process was incredibly easy and I had a replacement in not time. Logitech? I’ve tried several times on their website, and it always kicks me out before completing the process. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!  This is the one that really works with IPad Pro
customer_reviews.text: This is my second iPad Pro keyboard, (previously had one of the cheaper color versions from Amazon for around $50 and it died within 4 months). Using this as I type and LOVE that the power comes from my ipad. No extra charging cords. The flexibility of this keypad is great as I can easily use or not the keypad. Also love that it stows the iPencil so well. Great protection for the ipad as it doubles as a cover and when a glass of water spilled the other day I was seriously happy it was inside the cover. Easy to use keypad...really a winner on all counts.
customer_reviews.author: Straight-Talk

customer_reviews.title: It just keeps breaking
customer_reviews.text: This product is great in so many ways!!!!!! I love it EXCEPT it keeps breaking in the same spot. I've had two of these cases and both of them broke in the same place. I wish I could endorse this case but I just can't. I need to know that when I snap my iPad into a case that it will stay in place and won't fall out. I don't have that confidence with this case.
customer_reviews.author: tsmith77

customer_reviews.title: Think twice, read reviews
customer_reviews.text: Had about 2 weeks. Solid case, holds 9.7 quite well, good angle of screen, solid key stroke feel, and that's where it ends. Pencil rests on glass when closed - terrified of putting in carryon to have it compressed and damage screen or pencil.. Also causes case to close unevenly at the edge. Backlit - your wife will hate. You have to have the light on to use it. Don't stop to think, as it dims so quickly you have to hit the space bar to then delete the space to get the light back on. So disappointed. People must be warned of these issues.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this case
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this case! The backlit keyboard is so helpful as I tend to use it during different points of the day. As a student in college, I do not regret spending the money on getting this! It is VERY protective of my iPad and Apple Pencil, and after a year of use, it shows no signs of wear and tear. I would say that a disadvantage is that because it magnetically connects to the Smart Connector, there are limited angles you can type with the keyboard, and I do have minor software problems once every few weeks (though it is fixed simply by restarting the iPad). Definitely recommend for those on the fence about it!
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for iPad Pro 2017 9.7”
customer_reviews.text: Logitech does it again with a perfect keyboard for the previous generation (2017) iPad Pro 9.7”. It types better than the Apple Smart Keyboard and makes for a better case. You won’t be sorry if you get this. NOTE: this keyboard case is NOT compatible with the iPad 2018 or anything other than iPad Pro 9.7” previous generations, so if you have another type of iPad or iPad Pro, fear not: Logitech makes keyboard cases for them (except maybe the new Mini, not sure on that).
customer_reviews.author: cinji

customer_reviews.title: Not terribly durable
customer_reviews.text: First, the good: The keyboard is excellent. The backlighting makes this worthwhile. The bad: unfortunately, the plastic that is used to retain the iPad is not particularly durable. It is prone to breaking below the apertures for the speakers, and it's proven very difficult to glue or otherwise repair. For future iterations of this, Logitech should consider a more durable resin or reinforce the thin spots or some similar change. The design isn't bad, but it's not durable enough for everyday use - mine cracked from being dropped from a couple of inches onto a desk.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Not the most durable item...
customer_reviews.text: I made this purchase to replace a CREATE keyboard purchased from VERIZON ($100) for my 9.7 iPad Pro about 16 months ago. Unfortunately, that keyboard suddenly fell victim to intermittent connections and failure to connect issues that rendered it unusable. Looking online, I found many customers experiencing similar issues. Unfortunately, I could not fix the one I had and the warranty had expired. I liked the unit so much I ordered another ($65), but this time got the 4-year replacement warranty ($5) to avoid similar issues.
customer_reviews.author: Madtown buyer

customer_reviews.title: Very good keyboard and case
customer_reviews.text: Wasnt sure how much I would like using the keyboard but it has been great. Love that it doesnt require batteries or bluetooth. If using in the field as a part of holding/selling some have mentioned not liking it folded back with your hand underneath on the keyboard. I agree, not my favorite way to hold. However you can fold it a different way with the back of iPad over the keyboard. This works better but back of iPad will slide around on top of keyboard. I solved by simply placing a small strip of velcro at the bottom of the keyboard and back of iPad. It works perfect now for holding and presenting without sliding around.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle2here

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative but falls short on protection
customer_reviews.text: Writing this review after more than a year of use: - Great portability especially when you want to write something. I’m a writer so I need to be putting down my thoughts as quickly as I could. Angle is also great whenever I type or even watch a movie. The connector works well. - Not the best in terms of protection. Like one of the other review mentioned, it slips off easily from the “grip” but when it slieds and falls off accidentally, it’ll really hit the ground hard. It already created a dent into lower portion (near the speakers). I even have a glass protector for it and it still chipped off.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: The Best Keyboard for iPad Pro!
customer_reviews.text: In love with my new Logitech iPad Pro keyboard! I can't believe I am saying this but Apple missed the mark with their own iPad Pro keyboard. I purchased the Apple keyboard and it literally gave me arthritis after just 5 minutes of use. It was so painful I returned it the very next day and purchased this one to ship same day. Wow... It has everything I needed! Connects directly to the iPad Pro so there is no bluetooth pairing needed or even charging. Just plug and play. Lighted keyboard, easy to press keys, no bluetooth, no charging needed, Apple pencil holder and case all in one. It's everything I needed for my iPad Pro!
customer_reviews.author: Lorena Frith

customer_reviews.title: Solid work accessory
customer_reviews.text: Works extremely well. A little on the heavy side but a fair trade off for robustness. iPad pops out easily (only when you want it to) if you prefer to ditch keyboard for awhile. It may go unnoticed but because it uses the special port to power and connect, when you fold it for reading mode there is no power drain and pressing buttons does nothing which is great. You can also type on your lap. I would recommend for work users on the go. I have Citrix loaded and it's a great combo with the X1 mouse. Turns it entirely into Windows tablet. (Steve Jobs rolling in grave.)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Minor cosmetic issues, but an overall great keyboard case for the ipad!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard works great with my ipad. The tablet fits securely and feels very sturdy. I only have two problems with the keyboard. The button cutouts are really shallow, making it hard to change the volume. The other problem is that thetablet doesn't lay flat when the keyboard part is folded back. I use my ipad vertically to read sheet music most of the time, and having my ipad that's angled slightly to the side makes that harder.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Works okay with the pencil
customer_reviews.text: Works and everything, and it fits the pencil. But it doesn't always close perfectly, and you can't use it with an apple pencil cap keeper thingy... Prevents it from closing. The keyboard itself connects through the so-called smart connector... Which seems a little temperamental. The outside of the cover is like a mesh fabric sort of texture. I don't think it'll stay clean or be easy to clean. All in all, it's decent. If you want to be able to type on your iPad, and keep your overpriced Apple pencil, it seems to be the best option out there.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works well, just don't try to charge your iPad Pro while using it.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great keyboard. They keys have great travel and spacing. I love the back lights but wish they were a bit more bright on full brightness. The lone but glaring issue is that you cannot charge your iPad while docked to this keyboard. I've had my iPad die while using it plugged into a power source. This us inexcusable. I'm not sure who to blame.....Logitech or Apple. Either way this is a simple software patch that no one is trying to fix on either side. It's almost a deal breaker. Hopefully this gets sorted out sooner than later.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cleaves

customer_reviews.title: Good but has a design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Have had 2 of these... the first one broke right at the speaker area... so I bought a new one about a year ago. The exact same thing happened. I have an IPad Pro and it just seems like there should be metal inside the plastic arm that goes around this... its just plastic and the plastic breaks over time from the stress of the ipad that is snug in the device. other than this, it is a great device. Device is charged by the ipad, keyboard is good and responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Bronxslice1

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Really like it. Just a few comments - it needs a locking mechanism so it doesn't open up in either of the two positions. Its also a bit awkward to use in landscape format - its actually more comfortable to hold it upside down which means FT is a bit harder. I also wish the keyboard would come off while leaving the back protector in place rather than to have to take the whole thing of for when you don't need the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Torbjorn Karlsson

customer_reviews.title: Functional keyboard case with nice design.
customer_reviews.text: Does not protect on a drop as well as some other folding units, but this works well and I appreciate the flexibility. Really like the ipencil holder and the non-bluetooth connection. Well backlit keyboard with decent travel. I've owned several other cases, including to hard body cases, both of which have ultimately proven to be very costly compared to their longitivtiy. Practically speaking works well for carrying the iPad and pencil in a brief or backpack. Would not recommend for children/construction sites/high drop tendencies.
customer_reviews.author: NorCal Bear

customer_reviews.title: Good Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced my Apple Keyboard with this Logitech. The Apple Keyboard was a $150 piece of garbage. It finally completely fell apart after one year...during which I had constant connection troubles. Out of the box, this logitech has a much better feel and has much better protection for the ipad. I read the other reviews about durability and will update this review if that becomes an issue. I am not experiencing the charging issues others have mentioned. This ipad seems to charge fine while the keyboard is connected.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN ROACH

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact that the keys are easy to use ...
customer_reviews.text: This iPad Pro 9.7 backlit keyboard case does everything it says it will do: protect the iPad and pencil. I like the fact that the keys are easy to use and the keyboard itself is laid out quite nicely. Be aware that there isn't anyway to 'charge' the case separately - it takes it's power directly from the iPad, when the iPad is propped up properly. It will bring down the battery life of the iPad noticeably.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard Case I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I have had a number of keyboard cases and this one is by far the best! Since it utilizes two contact points that are located on the side of the iPad Pro, the keyboard itself does not need to be charged separately. It draws power directly from the iPad. Additionally, unlike other keyboard cases, there is a built-in holder for the Apple Pencil. I had a Logitech and I damaged it at work so I bought a Brydge keyboard case. The Brydge keyboard case was bulky and uncomfortable to use. So, I went back to the Logitech. I also love that the keyboard lights up when you use it. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good protection. Great backlit keyboard. Crisp Typing Experience.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case. I love the amount of protection this case provides. The backlit keyboard is great. The keys are nice and “crisp” providing a great typing experience. It was easy to get the iPad into the case and begin the set-up. My iPad immediately noticed the new keyboard and begin downloading an update which took two mins and the keyboard began working perfectly. I also like the simple integrated sleeve to carry the apple pen. I like being able to use the keyboard or lay flat in tablet mode!
customer_reviews.author: Jason J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs, with one small flaw
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact it’s not a Bluetooth keyboard so I don’t have to charge it, and they actual keys feel good to use and don’t appear to lean on the screen when the case is closed. The iPad fits very nicely, although when using the iPad without the keyboard, the way the case folds is a little awkward. My case also has one button that is not backlit like it should be (the right arrow key). But other than those two small oddities/drawbacks, this case was exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa C.

customer_reviews.title: 7” iPad Pro over a year ago and have happily using it sans keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I got my 9.7” iPad Pro over a year ago and have happily using it sans keyboard. When I got my spouse a 10.5” iPad Pro for Christmas and was envious of its ability to power a keyboard. It wasn’t until I found this keyboard that I realized the 9.7” iPad had a power adapter and could do the same thing as its larger sibling. Connected easily right out of the box and after about 15 seconds of the iPad automatically downloading the driver, the keyboard lit up and I was typing away. Nice product and not cheap junk like some other keyboards I’ve used. Good keyboard feel and very responsive. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Randy G. Dodds

customer_reviews.title: Does not last.  Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I have purchased. The first went bad pretty quickly: the keyboard stop connecting to the iPad. We were just out of the send-back window. But I liked it while it worked. So I ordered another. Now, sadly, same story. I should have listened to the old adage "Once bitten, twice shy". Now I am twice bitten, forever shy. I won't be buying Logitech again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor design. poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: A few months after I bought this item, the case started cracking. It has never been dropped. I first glued the crack, but then another crack developed. I glued that one again, but then it cracked a third time. The parts that I glued are actually stronger than the case. When I contacted Logitech for a replacement, they said I could choose a replacement case. However, they no longer sell this case and they do not have a case that will fit the 9.7" iPad Pro that they will offer as a replacement. All that Logitech is offering me is condescending replies. For any Logitech item, if you do buy one, do not expect that they will honor their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Perfect companion for iPad
customer_reviews.text: This lives up to expectations, with my only gripe being that with the pen it takes just a tad of attention to close it properly. If your Apple Pencil has any sort of cap retainer, it may not close. I have a retainer and need to close it just so to get it right. In terms of toughness, this really keeps your iPad secure. Keypad has a great finger feel. I can type faster on that than on my normal keypad.
customer_reviews.author: P. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Charging Bug Makes It Unuseable.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard works niceley but has two major flaws. The big flaw and the reason I returned it was it has a bug that stops charging from happening. You can be plugged in and your battery just drains. A search of the Logitech support site shows this to be a common thing. The second flaw is that it is hard to close the case if you have an Apple Pencil in the holder. Not a big deal, just an annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, very low quality case that will develop cracks
customer_reviews.text: I am at my 2nd Logitech. First one developed a stress crack on the bottom right and left of the case, Logitech replaced it under warranty. The second one I currently have also developed stress cracks on each side as the first one did. The keyboard itself is excellent and has been working flawlessly, the case on the other hand needs to be reinforced in the bottom. I believe no design change has been done and new cases also have that flaw
customer_reviews.author: Leglode

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!! :D Love My new Smart Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: What a great Logitech product!!! You can’t even find this at the apple store or online! Great job bringing this on amazon. It is definitely a great buy, the case is excellent and the Smart Keyboard connection works wonderfully. As soon as I took it out of the box and placed my iPad on it. The keys lit up. No need for BLUETOOTH OR USB CHARGINING... it was exactly what i was looking for. I went to the apple store and had mistakenly purchased the wrong size for my iPad; however, it cost 160.00 for the smart key board cover.. needless to say i returned it and looked online and I was so HAPPY.. i stumbled upon it in amazon.
customer_reviews.author: fiorella

customer_reviews.title: Lasts only a year
customer_reviews.text: This is the second case I purchased. The first one died after a year. The second one died after a year. Both first stopped responding to the Ipad briefly before working again. Then the right side of the case would go "numb" and not respond at all before the left side would follow. Now it's essentially an $80 Ipad stand. So, after two of those, I think there is a major flaw in this devices. Why isn't Logitech taking them off the market?
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Apple version...
customer_reviews.text: I bought an Apple product to protect my iPad. At the same time I bought their iPad keyboard. After two years, the keyboard stopped making the necessary connection through the 3 pins and I received a connection error each time I tried. My guess is the hidden ribbon tape from keyboard to the connector wore out from being bent back and fourth while opening and closing the keyboard. Logitech solves this issue with a direct keyboard to pin solid connection. The included cover makes adjusting the volume via the buttons easier as well. While not very 'atractive,' I don't mind as I believe function before form is appropriate. I would not hesitate to buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: mSquared

customer_reviews.title: Not a durable design, breaks at the speaker orifice
customer_reviews.text: The case is functional and the keyboard is very good. The holder for the Apple Pencil works well and keeps the pencil securely. There is no Bluetooth or battery. The big problem is that the case breaks after a period of time and normal stress, in my case, near the top speaker opening. After that, there is not enough grip to hold the iPad in place. But, I can't say I have done damage to the iPad. I use a heavy rubber band to keep the iPad from slipping out of the case when mobile. Nice for a while, but don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Plimsoll

customer_reviews.title: 2nd attempt
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first Logitech keyboard and case just a little over a week ago. The keyboard never started up. I sent it back thinking it was an individual unit defect. The second case arrived and worked for 48 hours before it inexplicably stopped working. No keystrokes. No backlight. Nothing. I'm in the process of returning this one and will not try another Logitech product for my Ipad again. Save yourself the aggravation of multiple returns and buy something reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Cosley

customer_reviews.title: Gives good protection. Keyboard works well
customer_reviews.text: Gives good protection. Keyboard works well. Illumination can be adjusted as needed. Does not use Bluetooth, uses Apple's connection strip to the iPad and has no need to charge batteries. Works only in landscape, no contacts for portrait mode. Not a major problem. I have been using for a month and find it is far superior to the Apple keyboard. Does not effect battery performance​ that I can discern.
customer_reviews.author: G. Speck

customer_reviews.title: Durable, User Friendly, and Esthetically Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech CREATE Backlit Keyboard Case with Smart Connector is without a doubt the best keyboard I have ever purchased. It is sturdy and easy to use. I type all day long, an activity which I have been doing for the past fifty years, and I have never encountered a keyboard as comfortable, user friendly, and durable as this one.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed with this case considering that Logitech usually makes an ...
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this caseconsidering that Logitech usually makes an outstanding product. I probably should have returned this item but liked the idea that it was powered by the iPad with the Apple smart connectors. The case couldn't be more slippery. The thing was always sliding off my lap. I also found that the when using the Apple Smart Connectors the iPad would not charge properly and often the charging would shut off completely.
customer_reviews.author: gjwolak

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity stinks
customer_reviews.text: This is my second exactly the same keyboard. “Fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me.” The first keyboard lasted over a year before the connectivity Issue (constantly disconnecting) became too frustrating to use. This second keyboard that’s exactly the same hasn’t even made it a full year with exactly the same problem. This time I’m going to see if there is a warranty that will return my money.
customer_reviews.author: Suz717

customer_reviews.title: Case cracked by the speaker!
customer_reviews.text: The case cracked by where the speakers are. It won't hold it in place very well anymore because of it. I looked for somewhere to see about an exchange or something and didn't find anything and it was beyond the Amazon policy. Now it's been just over a year (busted within the first 3 months) so I guess there's nothing that can be done. Bummer. Otherwise would have been a great case. So buyers beware of this weakness in the design.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Handled my iPad Pro--Like a Pro!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and began using this keyboard case at a meeting this week and was amazed at the responsiveness of the keyboard and how quiet the keys were. I've never been able to take notes on a keyboard, during a meeting, until now. Easily connects, has a holder for my Apple Pencil. This Logitech Case handled my iPad Pro--like a Pro! Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B.

customer_reviews.title: Corner right arrow button disappeared
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this case for several months. First impression was sturdy. When using an apple pencil, it makes the case very tight to close. While the keyboard and connection seem easy, the durability and longevity of the case is a bit disappointing. I travel quite a bit but this case and my iPad are always in a padded backpack or carry on. It has not been handle rough but one day I opened it and the bottom right corner of the keypad had the key cover (right arrow key) missing. Would not reccomend this case for any seasoned road warriors. Does not hold up to normal wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Pat O'Key

customer_reviews.title: The second worked fine for about a month and then the entire keyboard ...
customer_reviews.text: This was my second go around with this keyboard. The first one cracked on the side under normal use. The back lighted keyboard light went out on the lower right keys. The supplier exchanged the defective keyboard promptly. The second worked fine for about a month and then the entire keyboard back lighting totally went out. So maybe I just got the bad keyboards. The keyboard types ok but the lack of backlighting makes it useless on an airplane where I do a lot of my work.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I am very satisfied with this keyboard/case
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this keyboard/case. Some reviews talk about it scratching the iPad, but I have seen no evidence of that. In fact, it protects the iPad very well. The magnetic Smart Connector connection works perfectly and the keyboard is a joy to use. Yes, it is small but it is supposed to be small. It does add a bit of heft to the iPad but I'll gladly trade that for the utility that this brings to the iPad. Thanks to this keyboard/case my iPad is now like a mini laptop. I use my iPad much more and I enjoy it much more. For me it is the perfect case for my iPad.
customer_reviews.author: DSpin

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Charge
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE - the keyboard, although heavy, is great - love the feel of the keys. However, the iPad will not charge when attached to the case and in the position to use the keyboard. If the iPad is laid flat it will charge but that kind of defeats the purpose of having a keyboard. Apparently this is a known issue but I did not see that in the reviews before purchasing. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: S. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Dead light on right arrow key
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, very sturdy but when i did turn it on for the first time the right arrow key light was dead.. But I will just have to live with it as I need it for my trip.
customer_reviews.author: Steven T.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Seems good. Did not fit my iPad. I think the description could have been clearer but in fairness, Apple has introduced so many models in a short time it leaves your head spinning. I had to return the keyboard. Amazon was once again user friendly and convenient in doing so. Turns out Zaag has a brick and mortar site near my home and I was able to go there with iPad in hand.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great case, broken plastic after 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard iPad case for my 9.7" iPad pro. I use it almost daily for school. I really like the case and the smart connection. I have had this keyboard case for just under two months and part has broken already. Part of the plastic by the charging port and speaker has broken. I take really good care of this iPad and case. It is in my backpack which has a padded pocket, and I am not rough with it at all. So I am disappointed that its already got a flaw. The break doesn't affect the functionality of the case, but it's not a cheap case. So I feel like it shouldn't be breaking so soon.
customer_reviews.author: a_goodman

customer_reviews.title: Best iPad Pro Smart Keyboard Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my iPad Pro (9.7in.). I love the design and the sturdiness. Top quality! Works seamlessly!! This offers more protection for my iPad than the Smart Keyboard by apple! Solid construction, which protects both the front and the back of my iPad. The backlight keyboard and pen holder are just a great added bonus. And it cost 1/3 of what Apple charges for their Smart Keyboard! I even prefer this over the Zagg Folio which I purchased for 3 times the cost of the Logitech Backlit Keyboard! Both the Apple (after 3 yrs and the Zagg (after 1.5 yrs) keyboards failed. But my iPad Pro still works flawlessly!!! Thanks Logitech!!! I love, love, love this product!
customer_reviews.author: natalie dc

customer_reviews.title: Love it !!
customer_reviews.text: I love it !! Keyboard is smooth, hassle free to connect the keyboard it does by its own as soon as you open the case, more key function to use from the keyboard to your iPad, good quality material that protects the iPad very well the only issue I see is that the screen position should have more options because sometimes the glare is too much especially if you are outside and needs to adjust to a different position, and only has one position.
customer_reviews.author: Silvia H.

customer_reviews.title: Good overall Keyboard Case
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good keyboard case, I work off my iPad everyday and there keyboard is good size that I am feeling like I need to adjust from a normal keyboard. Having the backlight is great and the multiple options for standing are excellent. The only disappointment would be that there is no place to put the pencil.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Barsantee

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice case and keyboard combination. The case protects the iPad well. I had to have the first one replaced because the keyboard was DOA. Amazon replaced it immediately. I was pleased with their response and ease of getting a replacement mailed. The replacement, after two months has developed a crack in the case and will no longer hold the iPad securely. This appears to be a design flaw because there are multiple reports of the same issue on the Logitech support portal. I really wanted to like this case. Once I get the replacement it's going on eBay.
customer_reviews.author: John Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Good for a year then falters...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased. Both worked well up to a year then began to not function properly. I am constantly fighting for a good connection between the unit and my iPad. I find myself using the screen based keyboard more often Which entirely defeats the purpose for which I purchased to begin with. Also, the plastic retainer arm on the left cracked within a year on both units. This unit barely leaves the table next to my easy chair so there is no harsh use..
customer_reviews.author: knute

customer_reviews.title: but I am living with it since I like this KB in all other respects
customer_reviews.text: Well, I would give this 5* but... I have used this for around 2 months, and already the light is out behind the right-arrow key. Bottom right corner of the KB, but I am living with it since I like this KB in all other respects. Pencil slot, power off the iPad, backlight, what is not to like? But come on, 2 months and backlights are going out?
customer_reviews.author: RedpointRik

customer_reviews.title: Not good in longer term :( boo.
customer_reviews.text: Update: after a month or so the connectors quit staying connected and now the keyboard is super annoying. It is disconnected more often that connected. The stand is not sturdy enough to keep the iPad upright/connected. Extremely dissapointed, as the cases were very expensive. This school year I have to replace both of them so my kids' heads don't explode in frustration. Worth the extra money for the pin connector instead of Bluetooth. We have two of these and they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased this keyboard before when i first got my iPad Pro. Paid over a $100 for it. Worked well, then replaced it with a cheaper keyboard, and that worked well for a while. Seen this one at $57.00 and liked the first one so well, ordered this one. Had nothing but problems with it since. Had it one month now. Keys don’t work, they lock up, freezes the page. Have to keep lift the screen and readjusting to the keyboard. Not sure if this was why it was only $57.00. Was listed as new, not sure it was...... sorry for the bad review that that is where I’m sitting right now.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki E

customer_reviews.title: Much better than what Apple offers, and cheaper!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good about it! The keyboard works wonderfully, it uses a negligible amount of power, and that is in spite of the keyboard lighting up when you're typing! Typical Logitech excellence!
customer_reviews.author: BobHOKC

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product and really enhances the iPad Pro
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product and really enhances the iPad Pro. A part of it failed after using it for a couple of months so we contacted Logitech support. They took care of the problem right away by sending us a new one and asked us to keep the old one. We are extremely pleased with this product and their support is next to none! Great support team.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Dan

customer_reviews.title: Better than bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: I was previously using a Bluetooth keyboard and it was a pain in the butt and then it died. I've had this one for about a week. The touch is nice. It never disconnects or goes to sleep as long as the iPad is awake (unlike the Bluetooth). So far I am happy with my purchase and I think it was worth spending extra for the constant connectivity and the relative sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: calamityj

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in December 2018, works great, however case cracked at bottom of speaker. It has never left my house, and well taken care of. It is now April and past Amazon return period. Logitech will only replace with a standard keyboard, not a case, and not back lit. Logitech customer support has requested the same information multiple times, photos, receipts, etc. This is my 2nd Logitech product that has broken and is not replaceable, first was a Logitech remote from Best Buy, it immediately broke and Best Buy nor Logitech warrant universal remotes. I will never buy any product made by Logitech again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to complain except it adds a quite bulk and weight to the Ipad Updated after 4 months: I hope I can give this 0-star for this product. it stops works after 4 months though I rarely use. The keyboard cannot connect with my Ipad anymore. What an expensive garbage!
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: the design of this cover is good but I bought it just for the replacement of ...
customer_reviews.text: the design of this cover is good but I bought it the 2nd time just for the replacement of the same Logitech cover which has button broken. although it was used less than a year for the last one, the local distributor just refused to fix or replace it even under warranty, so why don't I bought it from Amazon to save 200HKD... on the other hand due to this i am a bit doubt for the quality of the last cover I bought but no other choice as I feel it's design is better than apple
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shame On Me
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I ordered. The first one broke and I thought my grandchildren had dropped it. Second showed me just how wrong I was. Broke again in identical place (without little hands). Would not recommend it for anyone who actually uses their computer. I will now search again for something that will hold up longer than 8 months
customer_reviews.author: awesome-annie

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the Smart Keyboard that I purchased with my iPad. I had too many accidents where the iPad released from the case. I eventually had to purchase a new iPad when the screen shattered. The Logitech does a better job of securing the iPad in the case and I liked the Apple pen holder but what made me go back to my old Smart Keyboard was that the Logitech case pressures the power button so that when I hit the home button the iPad would often take a screen shot. Just annoying enough for me to give up the safety of the Logitech for the better performance of the Smart Keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: MR R BRADFORD HEYWOOD

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to insert the iPad in to the case
customer_reviews.text: The case fits my iPad Pro 9.7" well and does not obscure the camera lens or lamp. It was easy to insert the iPad in to the case. The smart connect keyboard is great - no set up or pairing required and no need to worry about a battery. The keys are stable, unlike the Apple keyboard case I had which tended to rock and not sit flat on a surface. Having backlit keys is a great feature. I can fold the keyboard out of the way and it is still slim enough to fit my folding wire stand. I like having a handy place to store my Apple Pencil, too. So far this case with keyboard is impressing me.
customer_reviews.author: Edward (Ted) Howell

customer_reviews.title: Backlit keyboard is great
customer_reviews.text: I love it BUT—the magnet is not strong enough to hold it to the smart connector when picked up. Not a deal breaker, but very close. I pointed this out to the seller, and they said that’s “normal”. It caused me to drop the iPad once, so now I’m very careful when picking up from keyboard position. I love the backlit keyboard. That alone makes it better than the Apple Smart Keyboard, which I had to return to Apple twice. With a stronger magnet this device is worth every penny as much as the Apple.
customer_reviews.author: Tom4Golf

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed In the Breakage
customer_reviews.text: I just starting using this keyboard two weeks ago and a piece of the keyboard on the side just dropped off. It broke away from the keyboard. I like the keyboard, but I was totally disappointed because of the amount of money I paid for it and I just purchased it in June 2018. The concept of this keyboard is nice, but may be a little heavy for some people.
customer_reviews.author: Joncee

customer_reviews.title: Purchased same product 3 times... all broke in less than 90 days in the same place.
customer_reviews.text: The product broke in the same place the previous three of the same type did. The location is critical to holding the tablet in place. Amazon will not allow this post because it is critical to their policy. The product was less than 45 days old when it failed the last time.
customer_reviews.author: odaat

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Ipad keyboard/case combo!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Ipad keyboard/case combo! Very sturdy material for the outer casing. All buttons are still accessible. And its a lighting connection for the keyboard so its powered by the Ipad so no seperate charging is needed. I love it! The one gripe I have is when its folded in and you are not using the keyboard is kind of awkward to hold but not that big of an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: When cheap plastic breaks you are screwed
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic tension holders break. Next stop garbage dump. You can't fix it. You lose! Just like me.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: It’s great.... for a short period of time!  Then it sucks.
customer_reviews.text: So initially I really liked this keyboard.... initially. Now, two years later, it doesn’t work at all. Probably about a year in it started being glitchy and only working part of the time (or when I had the iPad angled just the right way) . I am frustrated because I paid over $100 for it two years ago and now it is half the price (which is what the price should have been initially if it were only going to function consistently for one year). Ugh! Buyer beware. It is a great product when you first get it but then it craps out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm thrilled with this purchase. The attachment method to the iPad is the only con. I feel it's mediocre at best. Other than that one complaint this is a great keyboard case. Backlighting is awesome, the angle is good, strong magnets, and a spot for the Apple Pencil. The feel of the keys is nice, typing experience given the size is great. I would absolutely buy this again, its the best case I have seen for the iPad Pro as of my purchase date.
customer_reviews.author: B. Upton

customer_reviews.title: Very nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other keyboards including one from the maker of the iPad. This keyboard has more room, the key are slightly larger but they are quite. I have large fingers so this is very important to me. I also like the fact that it is a Smart Keyboard and does not require a Bluetooth connection.
customer_reviews.author: pg

customer_reviews.title: Far better than Apple's keyboard, but only use on flat surfaces
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy outer shell which protects my iPad Pro very well and provides perfect contact to enable charging and communication. Keyboard is well-lit and the feel of the keys is comfortable. My only knock on this product is that the nature of the flexible stand makes is nearly impossible to use without it resting on a flat surface. Difficult to use on your lap without a lap desk, book, or other surface large enough on which to rest the entire bottom of the opened unit.
customer_reviews.author: Marko RamiusTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a year and half
customer_reviews.text: For as much as I did pay for this, this device just hasn't cut it. One of the keys stopped lighting up several months ago. The case itself seemed rather flimsy and eventually it broke. I use my iPad about 1-3 hours a week at most. It doesn't go anywhere, rarely. Very limited use and the case basically wore out. The iPad no longer stays locked in the case, so the case itself is virtually useless.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable keyboard and seller
customer_reviews.text: Every! Single! Time! I have to “update the software” when connecting my iPad as well if my iPad locks and I unlock it I get another “update the software” notification. There are also time the keyboard didn’t connect at all after the “update” This has happened before and after iOS 11. The seller was no help. They asked lots of questions as if they were going to help but in the end it’s been weeks with no further response and basically a worthless $100 keyboard! BIGGEST WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: AGarcia73114

customer_reviews.title: Good but Flawed
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Logitech keyboard I’ve had. I LOVE the product. HOWEVER, keys have fallen off and the holding mechanism has broken on two different keyboards. If there were an alternative I’d buy it. As it is, I consider it a consumable product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great iPad keyboard case.
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this case. She uses it with her original iPad 9.7 pro, and it works great. She used to only use a regular iPad case, but now uses this one all the time as she can type so fast with it and she likes the angle of the screen. Worthwhile purchase. Seems to be high quality. Never have to worry about batteries for it as it draws off your iPad.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Wife likes how it looks and how the keyboard works.
customer_reviews.text: Gift for wife. Replaced a Clamcase that fell apart. The keyboard connection is NOT bluetooth, which is actually a plus if you don't want to use the keyboard apart from the iPad. Logitech quality is consistently good. No complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dickens Devotee

customer_reviews.title: faulty design
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with this product. I purchased 2 of these and each one became defective just after purchasing. There is a plastic housing on each side that holds the iPad in place - they break easily causing the iPad to not be secure. My iPad slipped out and I had to replace screen $300 bucks. They should probably make the housing brackets on the sides with metal instead of plastic. Shame, I really like this case - it's the best on so far for my iPad pro 9" but I've spend over 120 bucks on 2 of these and neither are usable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to overpriced apple product
customer_reviews.text: If you have an iPad with a smart connector.... take advantage of it. It is by far the best way to connect a keyboard. My only gripe with it is that because you use the smart connector, the angle is a little steep. But this is a far better product than the Apple Smart Cover and a better value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Very good case for everyday abusing. irgnore other review.
customer_reviews.text: I bough this case based on an opinion of a youtuber on youtube.So far, It has been serving its purpose very well. I couldn’t describe how much premium feeling in this case. The canvas material cover outside and the design for using smart connector( which should be on all keyboard-case for ipad pro) give me the feeling and want to abuse my ipad even more. Furthermore, for budget and price point this should be a 5 star product in among of other case, Eventhough there are more crappy case out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IPad keyboard and case
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one. I like it’s it charges from the iPad and you do not have to charge it separately. However, the plastic in the sides are not durable. I have never dropped my iPad, but the sides break very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great small keyboard for typing on an iPad in a pinch.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Key travel is pretty good. Feels better than a lot of iPad keyboards. Stays closed with magnets. Probably won’t fair well in a drop, but thin and pretty light overall. Hotkeys are a nice touch also. Cons: The right arrow key is not backlit. I first thought this was a defect and started down the path of a warranty claim with Logitech. After a bit of research, I found this was actually a design choice by Logitech and that single key is the only one not backlit on the board. It’s only slightly maddening for any OCD people out there. But the keyboard functions perfectly otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: iPad case w/backlit keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect product. The case is durable enough yet still lightweight enough to carry around. The pen holder is exactly what I needed and now I use my iPencil more. The backlit keyboard display is great and makes for easy typing without have to turn the lights bright. Its well with the investment over cheaper cases I’ve used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Jabie Jitta

customer_reviews.title: it slips out and is not sturdy. Picked case up today and iPad fell out ...
customer_reviews.text: Very upset with product. The case doesn’t hold iPad securely, it slips out and is not sturdy. Picked case up today and iPad fell out and shattered The keyboard doesn’t work now either. Have purchased Logitech products before and have always been happy but this is not the quality that they normally provide and know I’m not out only the case but an iPad Pro
customer_reviews.author: Kay M.

customer_reviews.title: Space bar on keyboard ceased working reliably within two weeks of purchase.  Cheap stuff.
customer_reviews.text: This product was ordered to replace a Logitech backlit keyboard for iPad that I used reliably until the case was damaged. The keyboard was sturdy and worked reliably. Thisitem as you cansee frommy typing doesnot have a working space bar. It is impossibly flimsy at its hefty price. And I depend on this iPad for my communications with health care providers during the ongoing pandemic. Not sure I candepend on Amazon as a vendor if this happens. Will try to return it but thatwill be a hardunder the circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: Paula F. Krauss

customer_reviews.title: My dream keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This product is phenomenal! It’s better than the one I bought previously. It’s perfect. The last one was clunky, it did sometimes did not work, I think it damaged when I bought it. It cost 150 at the time. This keyboard works perfect and its less now. I wish I got the blue one tho 😏
customer_reviews.author: whitney denise

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard / protection for iPad Pro
customer_reviews.text: I bought this few year ago to protect my iPad Pro 9.7”. It is much better than Apple options and cost a lot less. Doesn’t need batteries, silent, with lite keyboard. Perfect to replace my PC when I’m traveling. I was lucky to find this new unit to replace the old one after these year where it served brilliantly.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Beroiza

customer_reviews.title: Buy this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! The amount better this keyboard is compared to a Bluetooth keyboard is amazing. The connector thing really makes a huge difference for the better. If you need a keyboard for your iPad, get this one. It is extremely well made and just works. No, it just works awesome!
customer_reviews.author: drs

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Great product before it breaks! This is the second case for the same iPad. Both broke within a year of receiving it from amazon Not sturdy! When broken it will not capture the iPad
customer_reviews.author: RileyCtr
